DataElement.preferredName: Specimen Availability Person Biopsy Ability Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The coded response for questions to determine clinical trial eligibility that address the availability of specimens and the ability of a person to have a biopsy as outlined in the study protocol.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Specimen Availability Person Biopsy Ability Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis._The quality of being obtainable or accessible and ready for use or service._A human being._The removal of tissue specimens or fluid from the living body for microscopic examination, performed to establish a diagnosis._The quality of being able to perform; a quality that permits or facilitates achievement or accomplishment._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Specimen; a bit of tissue or blood or urine that is taken or used for research purposes.

Concepts.definition: A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.

Property.preferredName: Availability Person Biopsy Ability Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: The quality of being obtainable or accessible and ready for use or service.:A human being.:The removal of tissue specimens or fluid from the living body for microscopic examination, performed to establish a diagnosis.:The quality of being able to perform; a quality that permits or facilitates achievement or accomplishment.:Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: The quality of being obtainable or accessible and ready for use or service.
The removal of tissue specimens or fluid from the living body for microscopic examination, performed to establish a diagnosis.
The quality of being able to perform; a quality that permits or facilitates achievement or accomplishment.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator to represent a response of Yes, No, or Not Applicable._The affirmative response to a question or activity._The non-affirmative response to a question._Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Is archival tumor tissue avai
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is archival tumor tissue available for analysis (minimum 20 5 um slide) or patient is able to undergo a baseline fresh tumor tissue biopsy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient is in Group 2, is archived or fresh tumor tissue available from the non-craniotomy site and will have fresh tumor tissue available from the planned craniotomy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has baseline tumor specimen been requested or if adequate archival tissue is not available, is fresh tumor biopsy clinically feasible?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient is in cohort 2 (Colorectal cohort), is patient able to undergo a fresh tumor biopsy for the purpose of screening for this clinical trial (including able and willing to give valid written consent) or to provide an available archival tumor sample taken less than 3 months prior to study enrollment if a fresh tumor biopsy is not feasible with an acceptable clinical risk?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient willing and able to provide an adequate archival tumor sample available to confirm HER2 status by Central Laboratory (if local testing is used for enrollment), or willing and able to provide an adequate archival tumor sample for HER2 testing centrally?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Are there bone marrow mononuclear cells available for submission to EET Biobank at baseline/screening?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is archival specimen available for submission to EET Biobank or will baseline biopsy be done prior to starting Course 1 Day 1?
